Information published. 
AMD: CVE-2023-20588 AMD Speculative Leaks Security Notice 
On this page 
 
CVE-2023-20588 
Security Vulnerability 
Released: Dec 12, 2023  
Assigning CNA: 
AMD 
CVE-2023-20588  
 
Impact: Information Disclosure 
Max Severity: Important 
The following table provides an  
exploitability assessment 
 for this vulnerability at the time of original publication. 
Publicly disclosed 
Exploited 
Exploitability assessment 
Yes 
No 
Exploitation Less Likely 
Why is this AMD CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in certain processor models offered by AMD. The mitigation for this vulnerability requires a Windows update. This CVE is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest builds of Windows enable the mitigation and provide protection against the vulnerability. 
Please see the following for more information: 
AMD-SB-7007 
Microsoft recognizes the efforts of those in the security community who help us protect customers through coordinated vulnerability disclosure. See  
Acknowledgements 
 for more information. 
To determine the support lifecycle for your software, see the  
Microsoft Support Lifecycle 
.

metadata.title: CVE-2023-20588 AMD: CVE-2023-20588 AMD Speculative Leaks Security Notice
metadata.summary: AMD processors are affected by a security vulnerability, CVE-2023-20588, leading to information disclosure. The vulnerability impacts certain processor models offered by AMD and requires a Windows update for mitigation. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions to enable the mitigation and provide protection against the vulnerability. The affected products include Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11 versions. The severity of the vulnerability is rated as Important. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to protect their systems from potential exploitation. No specific workaround or mitigation beyond the provided security updates is mentioned in the post.
metadata.nvd_description: a division-by-zero error on some amd processors can potentially return speculative data resulting in loss of confidentiality.
